channel.title: Niels Degrande's Blog
channel.description: Insights on AI, coding agents, software engineering, and technology.

item.title: Claude Code 2.0: First impressions
item.description: I revisit my coding agent benchmark and put Claude Code 2.0 with Sonnet 4.5 to the test, migrating a UI from MUI to shadcn/ui with a human in the loop.

item.title: Travel planning with Comet
item.description: A hands-on look at Perplexity Comet for travel planning: benchmarking, speed, accuracy, and real-world hotel booking.

item.title: Rehosting
item.description: How I rehosted two simple websites using GitHub Pages, Cloudflare (DNS, Pages, Email forwarding), and SMTP2GO to cut costs while keeping the same features.

item.title: Incident agent
item.description: A vacation project that explores the OpenAI Agents SDK to build a realtime, multi-agent voice assistant that joins your incident calls and helps resolve issues.

item.title: Agent mesh
item.description: Exploring why enterprises may need an agent mesh and how Kafka fits.

item.title: Extend Darwin Gödel machines
item.description: Extend Darwin Gödel Machines for self-improving coding agents.

item.title: Agent builders
item.description: A developer-friendly tour of no-code, low-code and pro-code agent builder platforms.

item.title: Computer use, GPA and legacy
item.description: How generative process automation and emerging 'computer use' agents are reshaping legacy software automation.

item.title: Misbehaving LLMs
item.description: A lighthearted look at the odd ways large language models sometimes act up and what we can learn from them.

item.title: Reviewing generated code
item.description: Tips for staying sane while reviewing AI-generated pull requests.

item.title: Gemini Diffusion
item.description: First impressions after testing Gemini Diffusion.

item.title: Adapting to Generative Engineering
item.description: Adapting to Generative Engineering: A Developer's Guide to Staying Relevant

item.title: Personal agents
item.description: A look at the coming wave of personal AI companions that can operate everything from your inbox to your oven.

item.title: MCPify
item.description: Turn Swagger / OpenAPI specs into ready-to-run TypeScript MCP servers with a single command.

item.title: Codex vs. Jules
item.description: A hands-on verdict on the cloud-based coding agents Codex and Jules.

item.title: Herding agents
item.description: Reflections on how developers are becoming herders of parallel AI agents.

item.title: make initialize_blog
item.description: Automating my writing flow with make initialize_blog

item.title: Robust RAG
item.description: How to build robust Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, focusing on information extraction, retrieval precision/recall, and continuous evaluation.

item.title: Spectrum of coding agents
item.description: A tour across the spectrum of AI-assisted coding agents — from vibe-coding web builders to IDE copilots.
